title: Do you think that it is important to live your own truth? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would say there are two parts to that: First, living in objective truth, which is to say, living in the truth that is common to everyone. For example, “the sky is blue” is an objective truth, or “the Earth is round” is an objective truth. Second, is taking ownership of the consequences for how you live in objective truth. It isn’t enough to live in the same reality that everyone else lives in, you have to accept the consequences for how you live in that reality. If you don’t do these two things, you’re an objectively bad person. If you’re incapable of doing these two things, you’re probably a psychopath and should seek professional help.
Let’s be very clear: there is only one truth. Whatever you may imagine it to be (for you), that is not in the same category as the ‘real thing’ and living your life by it is a recipe for disaster.
